task_prefix: Pima Indians Diabetes dataset predicting diabetes onset based on diagnostic measurements. Focuses on females at least 21 years old of Pima Indian heritage, a population with high diabetes prevalence due to genetic predisposition and dietary changes. Each example contains 8 features. Predict the target class.

column_descriptions.preg: Number of times pregnant. Pregnancy affects glucose metabolism and is a risk factor for gestational diabetes leading to Type 2 diabetes.
column_descriptions.plas: Plasma glucose concentration at 2 hours in an oral glucose tolerance test (mg/dl). Primary diagnostic criterion for diabetes when ≥200 mg/dl.
column_descriptions.pres: Diastolic blood pressure (mm Hg). Hypertension is both a risk factor for and complication of diabetes.
column_descriptions.skin: Triceps skin fold thickness (mm). Proxy measure for body fat; obesity is major diabetes risk factor.
column_descriptions.insu: 2-Hour serum insulin (μU/ml). Indicates pancreatic function and insulin resistance.
column_descriptions.mass: Body mass index (weight in kg/(height in m)²). Key indicator of obesity and diabetes risk.
column_descriptions.pedi: Diabetes pedigree function. Scores likelihood of diabetes based on family history using genetic relationships.
column_descriptions.age: Age in years. Diabetes risk increases with age, especially after 45.

class_description: Classes: 'tested_negative' (No diabetes according to WHO criteria (500 instances, 65.1%)), 'tested_positive' (Diabetes present - 2hr glucose ≥200 mg/dl at any survey exam (268 instances, 34.9%))
